verses.text: Come, and let us return unto the \sc Lord\sc*: For he hath torn, and he will heal us; He hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After two days will he revive us: In the third day he will raise us up, And we shall live in his sight.

Then shall we know, \add if\add* we follow on to know the \sc Lord\sc*: His going forth \add is\add* prepared as the morning; And he shall come unto us as the rain, As the latter \add and\add* former rain \add unto\add* the earth.
O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? For your goodness \add is\add* as a morning cloud, And as the early dew \add it\add* goeth away.
Therefore have I hewed \add them\add* by the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: And thy judgments \add are as\add* the light \add that\add* goeth forth.
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; And the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But they like men have transgressed the covenant: There have they dealt treacherously against me.
Gilead \add is\add* a city of them that work iniquity, \add And is\add* polluted with blood.
And as troops \add of robbers\add* wait for a man, \add So\add* the company of priests murder \add in\add* the way by consent: For they commit lewdness.
I have seen a horrible thing in the house of Israel: There \add is\add* the whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, he hath set a harvest for thee, When I returned the captivity of my people.
